poem:
### The Ledger

In the quiet ledgers of power,  
where numbers whisper truth,  
a shadow moves in columns,  
unseen by public eyes.  
Questions rise like morning mist,  
yet meet the silence of the sun.  
Judge me, she says, on arithmetic,  
as figures dance, and silence speaks,  
in the audit of forgotten days.
